text: is a town located in Agawa District, Kōchi Prefecture, Japan. The town is famous for the production of . On October 1, 2004 the village of Gohoku, also from Agawa District, and the village of Hongawa, from Tosa District, were merged into Ino, increasing its size by almost a factor of five. As of April 1, 2017, the town has an estimated population of 22,155 and a population density of 47 persons per km². The total area is 470.71 km². ==See also== * Ino Paper Museum ==External links== * * Ino official website Category:Towns in Kōchi Prefecture
title: Ino, Kōchi
